intro: Thelypteris palustris, commonly known as the marsh holly fern, is a perennial fern native to wetland environments in North America. It has lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are typically 15–30 cm long and grow in a dense,丛生 manner. The fronds are bi- or tri-pinnate, with a distinctive dark green color and a leathery texture. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs, swamps, and along stream banks. The plant plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
